channel.title: tricks on Elena Pagnin
channel.description: Recent content in tricks on Elena Pagnin

item.title: Swedish
item.description: Technical Swedish Living and working in Sweden one can go by a long way with using just English. However, now and then comes the time when you are asked to provide a summary of your talk/thesis/work/grant proposal in Swedish. The usual workflow is to write a good piece of text in English, run it via google translator or chatGPT, but then, human-intelligence is needed to handle odd translation of terms that are rarely (if ever) used in Swedish.

item.title: Interview Questions
item.description: If you’re preparing for an interview (either as interviewee or interviewer), this is a good link to check out! It’s essentially a bot that returns common hiring questions for faculty appointments within computer science. Here you get a pdf with a good pool of questions for practicing.

item.title: About this website
item.description: How did I build this website? For academics, I think having a personal website is quite important as it allows you to quickly advertise news, collect and organize your work, and, most importantly, it is a great way for everyone around the world to know you exist and what you’re up to. For several years I have used jekyll, but it started to get messy with the latest OS updates and gem versions.

item.title: 4 LaTeX
item.description: Handy links for LaTeX Detexify automatic recognition of handwritten symbols latexpand to automatically combine all latex files into a single file. (If full latex is installed, you just need to type this command line: latexpand -empty-comments -o main_one_file.tex main.tex the long file output will appear in the Terminal) mathcha for creating tikz pictures in a more eye-friendly way FreeTikZ to transform handwritten diagrams into tikz TikZiT GUI editor for graphs and string diagrams
